description: ID for a Cohort Membership Data Load

Student_Cohort__Abstract_Object.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Student_Cohort__Abstract_ObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Student_Cohort__Abstract_Object.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

validation.validation: Submit either Student Reference or Academic Record Reference.
Enter an Add as of Date that is on or after the matriculation date of [date].
Submit an assignment type reference that is an override for criteria-based cohorts.
Submit an assignment type reference that isn't an override for manual cohorts.
The specified student has been merged with another student record. Specify the merged student instead.
Specify an Academic Record Reference. If you're using a version before v30.0 of the web service operation, update to the latest version.
The Update assignment type is only valid for athletic team student groupings. Submit an assignment type reference that's valid for student cohorts.
You can only specify an expiration date for temporary overrides. To submit this regular override, remove the expiration date.
Specify an Override Expiration Date that is after the Assignment Date.
You can't submit Override Expire as the Assignment Type Reference when you want to schedule an override that expires. Specify a temporary override as an assignment type instead.
Submit an Assignment Date for the student that is after the latest date of addition to the cohort.
Submit an Assignment Date for the student that is after the latest removal date from the cohort.
You can only specify Override Add as the Assignment Type when the preceding or next existing membership change doesn't have the same assignment type.
You can't submit a student who isn't a member of [COHORT].
You can't submit a student who is already a member of [COHORT].
You can't schedule a membership change on or between the start and expiration dates of an existing temporary override.
You can only specify Override Remove as the Assignment Type when the preceding or next existing membership change doesn't have the same assignment type.
You can only schedule a temporary override when there aren't existing membership changes on or between the intended override start and expiration dates.
You can't specify Override Add or Override Remove as the Assignment Type when the next existing membership change adds the record to the cohort based on criteria.
You can’t schedule a temporary or a regular override when the next existing membership change removes the academic record from the cohort based on the criteria.
To update a student membership in a cohort, ensure that the student has an academic record.
